result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 21CF315, 21CF377, 22CF384, 22CF385. 10:21 AM Defendant Donovan J Dobyns in court, in custody.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Donovan J Dobyns.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. ADA to file amended information. In 21CF315 amended count 1- def- G plea. CT accepts, adj G. 21CF377, 22CF384, 22CF385 RI&D on state's motion. Counsel stipulates to 93 days credit. Def requests to waive PSI. CT finds waiver is made FK&V. 

SENTENCE: W/held 3 years probation. 9 months banked jail for probation. Not subj to GT. If def objects to any banked jail, written request must be made for hearing within 5 days. AODA and comply. Any treatment or programming required by agent. No drugs without a prescription. No drug para. Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. No contact with Christina Engel except as approved by agent. $300.05 fine/costs. $250 DNA surcharge, totaling $550.05, DNA sample. 5% surcharge to COCC. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. Bond previously forfeited is vacated, bond to be applied to fine/costs. Must report to Probation today. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. PCR. 93 days credit if revoked. 10:47 am adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Case Reassignment Order - Br. 2 to Br. 1

COVERS CASES: 21CF315, 21CF377, 22CF384, 22CF385. No contact with Christina Engel. No controlled substances without a prescription and only in the amount/frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

CASES 21CF315, 21CF377, 22CF384, 22CF385. 1:15 PM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Donovan J Dobyns appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Donovan J Dobyns.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. State req  cash bond to cover all cases. CT quashes warrants. CT sets bond. DSPH on new files. 1:26 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
